Reviews.Title: Flash bulb was defective, but otherwise great
Reviews.Author: Corey Scott
Reviews.Content: My rating doesn't reflect the fact that the flash bulb in mine was doa, because that could just as easily happen to any camera... It's just a little annoying that their QC department didn't catch it.  Anyways, Amazon is sending me a new one, and letting me use this one until the new one gets here.The quality is great overall.  Using ISO100 mode with a quick shutter speed produces an awesome quality outdoor scenery shot.  For indoors, I found that using the automatic shutter settings worked best, and indeed worked well.  I took a photo of a $5 bill (fitting the whole bill in the frame), and was able to clearly read the little "united states of america" written in the border around Lincoln's portrait.  In fact, I could even see the ink bleed on each of the little letters.  For outdoor shots, the 4x zoom doesn't seem to cost the photos any quality, and could even show some details better than i could see them with my own eyes, and I have perfect vision.With that said, there are a couple points which i don't like about the camera.  First, the quality of photos drops dramatically when you use an ISO setting much higher than 100.  Don't even bother with the ISO3200, it looks substantially worse than a cell phone camera.  I also don't like that it's one of sony's only cameras that doesn't have a Carl-Zeiss lens.  I was so used to Sony cameras using one, that I was surprised to find out that mine doesn't.  The Sony lens that it uses seems to work very well though, it may not even be noticeably different.  I also don't like that you have to remove the battery to charge it.  You can buy an additional charger that plugs directly into the camera, but why wouldn't they just give you one in the first place?  If i wanted to pay another $20 for that, then i would've just paid an extra $20 towards a more expensive camera to begin with.Overall I really like this camera, and would recommend it to anyone looking for a very cheap, but decent quality camera.  I am using mine with an 8GB Sandisk Memory Stock Pro Duo, which holds 1900 photos at full resolution, or 5.5 hours of video.--------------Update: Amazon was out of this camera, so they refunded my money, and I got a Sony DSC-W290 instead, which I am much happier with overall.  It's double the price though, so I guess you get what you pay for.  I don't think the S950 is the level of quality where you could expect to be happy with the camera for years to come; it's more of an introductory camera that you'd probably plan on replacing a year later.  I would change my rating to 3 stars if amazon let me.

Reviews.Title: Disappointing First Sony Cybershot
Reviews.Author: High Standards
Reviews.Content: I unfortunately agree with the other reviews. My friends had this brand so I purchased this camera as a preorder. It suffers from the following problems:1) Excessive noise in low light (grainy pics)2) No video zoom3) Slow response time. It does not take pics quickly and recover well.4) Poor focus.5) In playback, it takes a second for each and every pic to focus from initial graininess.I wish I could still return this item but alas, 30 days have passed and I threw out the box!

Reviews.Title: Disappointing Sony Product
Reviews.Author: Aman Datta "Aman Datta"
Reviews.Content: I am one of those typical Sony loyalist but I am very disappointed by this camera.  The noise on most photos was terrible especially in lower light.  Close up photos in bright sunshine was fine but I could not get a decent photo (with Flash).  Surprisingly, I had an issue with the Flash too since its coverage was very less and did not light up the subject(s) well or even uniformly.It's a great price but poor quality.  I am returning this product for another camera.

Reviews.Title: good camera for the money
Reviews.Author: G. G. Buckner "fe2manz"
Reviews.Content: so many people on here blast things for being cheap--guess what? If you buy the $150 Sony camera instead of the $350 one expect it to be $200 less effective. It is a fabulous camera for the money--I have had numerous photos published with it--and its predecessor--you have to accept limitations--it isn't made for night/low light or for long range work--other than that, it WILL be fine for you if you just like to have a camera handy, but don't want to spend more money. If you DO want more, go up the price line and you will find what you are looking for.

Reviews.Title: Super Camera
Reviews.Author: D. Starr
Reviews.Content: An excellent camera.  Easy, understandable directions.  Takes beautiful pictures.  An excellent price.

Reviews.Title: Good price, good camera
Reviews.Author: JOAN E. BEARD
Reviews.Content: I've been using my camera for a few weeks and I'm very pleased with its performance.The pictures are clean, the colours are vivid, and it's very easy to use.I have taken pictures in the dark and can see all the details of the items or persons in the shot.Uploading and sending pictures or videos are a breeze.Great camera.

Reviews.Title: Not worth it
Reviews.Author: C. Rifenberg
Reviews.Content: Overall I am not happy with this camera and here are the reasons:1) The USB cord is Sony proprietary.  This is a big problem for me.  Don't be deceived by the online images, this is NOT a standard cable.  I would not have purchased this camera if I would have known this upfront.2) Bulky:  I assumed that this camera would be slimmer so it could fit in my pocket easier.  Yes, it WILL fit in my pocket, but it's wide enough that they could have used AA batteries.3) The face recognition has never properly identified more than one person in the same shot.4) Flash is weak.5) Cannot zoom in video mode.The pictures are adequate, but better than my older digital cameras.Ok... what are the positives:1) Screen is a nice size.  The lack of a view finder provides an even bigger screen.2) Zoom is sufficient.  About as good as I would expect of a camera this size.3) Handles red-eye well.

Reviews.Title: Sony Means "No Baloney"
Reviews.Author: RCAV8TOR
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my girlfriend to replace her Nikon Coolpix because sand & digital cameras don't mix. She took the Nikon to the beach & got sand in the lens mechanism & it never recovered from that indecent exposure...Back to the Sony. It's a good point & shoot camera. Not too fancy & very easy to use. I have the DSC-S650 (older model) & like it a lot. The S950 is very much the same with a higher mega pixel rating. Shots are crisp & clear with auto adjustment, which I use almost exclusively, so this setting "should" consistently produce good results. Can't always say that about the subject matter though...The video mode is always a nice feature but it does have its limitations. You can't zoom in or out while you are in this setting. You can, however, zoom in while in the still photo mode & then switch to video afterwords using that last zoom setting. Most people don't know this little trick.Probably the only downside is the battery. The S950 uses Sony's proprietary (expensive) battery. You'll need to purchase an extra Sony battery for the S950 if you use it a lot & don't have the charger, or don't have time to charge the one battery. Remember to check the charge status so you don't end up with a dead battery when you need your camera the most for that graduation, wedding or bachelorette party, right girls?Last comment is you should get at least a 2G memory stick at time of purchase. Just like with computers, you can never have too much memory for your camera, especially if you get hooked on taking videos...

Reviews.Title: pretty disappointed
Reviews.Author: Janice M. Lauer
Reviews.Content: For the money, I'm pretty disappointed.  I'm no shutter bug, but it just isn't a sharp focus.  My daughter got much better pictures with her Cannon point & shoot.

Reviews.Title: Sony Has Some Issues Here
Reviews.Author: Bryan Torino
Reviews.Content: I purchased this Camera with the delusion that if you pay a decent price for a Sony product you could be assured that the quality of the product will be above average. Well, with the Cyber-Shot DSC-S950 you do not get what you paid for. For starters, you need a Sony only memory card, battery, and USB cables. They have adjusted the size of these items to only fit into thier cameras. So... any previous memory cards, batteries or cables are now obsolete and you have to buy the Sony Brand. The picture quality is very dark and at times very out of focus. Unless you have the perfect lighting you will end up with subpar pics. It also does not let you zoom during video mode and the audio is barely there. When you want to look back at pics it takes a second to focus every time for each pic which makes it very annoying when you want to scan through your photos. My previous camera was about $50 less exspensive and was a much better product. Pass on this one at all costs....

Reviews.Title: Get what you pay for
Reviews.Author: Michael Amancinelli
Reviews.Content: This camera has everything that it said but the picture quality is substandard. The color was dull and the sharpness wasn't there. I returned it the next day. Spend the extra money and get one with a Carl Zeiss Len's. I got the DSC-W230 and love it.............

Reviews.Title: it's okay so far...
Reviews.Author: J. Santos "wanderer"
Reviews.Content: I just got this camera today and so far it is is an okay camera. I've been feeling camera-handicapped these past few weeks so when there was a sale at staples offering this camera at $97 i decided, why not? I had been meaning to get one because i broke my other camera, which was a samsung s600. ALso, take note that i am not really a professional photographer. More like a point and shoot sort of gal. Although i will in the future invest in an slr of some sort.ANYWAYS, I will be updating this post over the time i have it and if after two days i find it adequate, i'll keep it. Otherwise it goes back to the store.NOTE: i also have yet to try this out in natural lighting.PROS:*Clarity; this camera, with its 10.1mp is quite nice in comparison to my previous camera, a samsung s600 (@6.1mp). I immediately noticed how much more brighter and clear and defined my pictures came out to be. With flash anyways.*i'm finding the macro option helpful, as well as the steady focus feature.CONS:*Without flash and in lowlight situations, it takes, realllly terrible pictures, with lots of noise, and plenty of blur.*When viewing pictures on it, they take a lot longer to load then they did on my samsung.*I tried out the video recording feature, and unlike my samsung, the mic is absollutely dreadful at picking up sounds. Even if you put it up to a speaker, it's just a faint hint of noise in the background when you play it back.That's it so far...i will update more soon.

Reviews.Title: Cheaper at Walmart
Reviews.Author: A. Huhn
Reviews.Content: I was at walmart this morning and saw this same camera for $129.00. I haven't bought this camera so I don't know how it operates but if you intend to buy it check out your local Wally World first.

Reviews.Title: Dang near perfect
Reviews.Author: Eric Lee "Mud Puppy"
Reviews.Content: This camera is great!  It's fairly small in size but takes amazing photos.  The only draw back I have found is that the battery seems to drain even when you aren't using it.  I need to charge it for a couple hours before I want to use it.  Video mode is great too.

Reviews.Title: I was disappointed
Reviews.Author: Rubberduckiemom
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera a year ago to replace the canon that I had lost and, overall, I was not pleased with the camera. I purchased it because I loved the idea of smile detection but that feature was a complete pain and it rarely worked! I now how and infant and his "smile" never registered- occasionally it would register a smile with my older nieces and nephews but RARELY. The picture quality was not as good as my previous Canon even though it had more mega-pixels. In the end, I dropped this camera in water (an accident, I swear) and I have now replaced it. Other reviews really seem to range from 1-5 so I guess it all depends on your expectations- I was disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Got Great Concert Shots
Reviews.Author: Camella Hayes
Reviews.Content: I got this camera just in time for a Styx concert where I had a front row, center seat.  I got some great shots with this camera, even with a little bit of movement from the band.  I was even able to get low light shots and shot some video.  I didn't realize the video would start out black, so I accidentally deleted that video, so I guess that would be my major gripe, that there doesn't appear to be a way to tell when you have a video for the technically unenlightened like myself.  I've been waiting for awhile for a digital camera and I am very pleased with this.  Worth the wait on pre-order as well.

Reviews.Title: It works allright.
Reviews.Author: Carlos
Reviews.Content: Pros: economical camera with high resolution and very compact.Cons: Bad sensitivity and resolution under low light. Flash bulb doesnt work after couple of years.

Reviews.Title: It's ok
Reviews.Author: Krystal Brumfield
Reviews.Content: Worked fine... But stopped working all of a sudden... The lens won't come out, worth the price though. Probably will start back working if I work with it...

Reviews.Title: recieved
Reviews.Author: Ms. Williams
Reviews.Content: love it. my favorite brand when it comes to digital cameras. works perfectly. I am always in some ones face with this thing aand shooting nature shots. thanks for offering this item

Reviews.Title: Number one camera
Reviews.Author: Randy A. Spaulding
Reviews.Content: I've had a DSC-950 for 2 years. this is one of the best cameras that I ever had. Everything about the camera is a plus. I had my first DSC-950 camera stolen at my Mothers funeral with a lot of pictures of my Mother and family. I looked at other cameras but for this style, the DSC-950 was the best. So I ordered another DSC-950. I am glad I found one because I guess they do not make the DSC-950 anymore. I Hope the person that took the camera enjoy it as I did.Randy Spaulding1614 Anchor Dr. E.Columbus, Ohio 43207

Reviews.Title: Nice camera from Sony
Reviews.Author: G Scott Kearns
Reviews.Content: great camera, does the job well and is compact and simple to use.  I recommend it highly for easy picture taking

Reviews.Title: I LOVE MY CYBER SHOT
Reviews.Author: L. Herman "Lorriefla12"
Reviews.Content: My other one broke I was so happy to find the 10.1 again, who needs all these fancy shmancy new designs with all this high tech crap for kids, this is easy to use I love the pink colour, so nothing is perfect, try some of the newer cams and see what new bigger problems you come up with, some of these reviews need to be reviewed hahahah!

Reviews.Title: Excellent product for the price
Reviews.Author: Corey Livingston
Reviews.Content: It takes 3-5 seconds between pictures, and it takes 2 seconds to take the picture, but for the price this is agood camera.

Reviews.Title: Extremely grainy pictures at high iso
Reviews.Author: HCE
Reviews.Content: DO NOT get this camera.  Anything with ISO over 100 results in grainy photos.  Avoid like the plaque.

Reviews.Title: Fair pictures, poor video
Reviews.Author: James Teal
Reviews.Content: I bought my Sony Cybershot in June 2009. During that time until now I have dropped it multiple times and even accidentally ran over it with my bike. It has gotten a few scratches, but I have not seen any internal damage as a result of the accidents, so it is very durable. It takes fair pictures, but poor video. Like, a little better than cell phone quality video, and the sound is muffled buzzing unless you talk directly into the mic. The pictures look good on the camera, but when uploaded to a computer, they turn out pixely. Is it worth the $190? I paid $150 for mine and it's been worth it, but I wasn't looking for good pictures, only a way to document good times with friends.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: TexasCajun
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera for a year now.  Needless to say I HATE IT.  Blurry photos..I need to adjust the settings every time I want to take a photo, so I end up taking multiple photos until I get one clear.  It however works great at close up shots.  I used it to sell jewelry online and got great up close photos.  Unfortunately, I need a camera for everyday family events and this one just doesn't suit my needs.  There is an 'easy' mode that is supposed to apply the correct settings for you.  That is a waste of space.  I haven't gotten many clear photos that way.  I will be purchasing a new camera.

Reviews.Title: WOW
Reviews.Author: Wise Reader "mom-of-two"
Reviews.Content: By 'Wise Readers' Daughter: This camera is amazing. It does have its ups and downs, but it is worth it. I admit I did not buy this on amazon, it was a Christmas present from Walmart. But for those of you who are buying online, this is my review: It has easy to use settings: up close for things like flowers (one of my uses, nature), scenery (mountains), and then of course your average photos. A button to turn flash off, and on with no issues. Zoom in and out works great. It even has an "easy" setting which simply shows you the battery left, and the number of photos left that you can take, kind of like your easy to use dispossable camera. The battery lasts... well not that long. If your on a long trip make sure your able to charge it every night, that is kind of a problem I know. Also, WARNING, the USB chord for this camera is a unique model, for some reason the company decided to make a chord that stores like walmart and target don't sell because it is so rare, and so few cameras use it. So buyer be aware, take care of your chord unless you want to go spend another $20 on a chord which is what I had to do, in fact i didnt even buy a new chord, i bought a memory chip reader so i could use it with my other electronics. But this camera is great otherwise, I took it with me on a 2 week trip to Italy, the detail in the close up photos is amazing.

Reviews.Title: Happy with the product
Reviews.Author: MeAtAmazon
Reviews.Content: Small and easy to carry. Picture quality good. The only problem is that the display on the screen is very dark(i guess i need to adjust the settings) but when transferred to laptop the pictures come out very nicely.PIctures at night also very good and clear.Video is of good quality. I was able to capture fireworks at night through video.Zoom is not that high but its ok for personal use.

Reviews.Title: Sony Camera
Reviews.Author: C. Hankley "Avid Reader"
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful camera and very user friendly.  It's the second Sony I've had.  They're great.

Reviews.Title: Great camera..!
Reviews.Author: Adrian "Adrian"
Reviews.Content: Til now the camera looks great, works great, easy to carry on, and blash feautures in it...!

Reviews.Title: cybershot love
Reviews.Author: Jennifer V. Niemi "nigigbezhig"
Reviews.Content: I really love my little cybershot.  It was well worth the wait (ordered in early February, with a late March release date).  I have the camera with me always.  It is easy enough for my 5 year old to use which is wonderful. Highly recommend this camera.  Great bang for the buck!

Reviews.Title: Good price
Reviews.Author: Jose Jimenez Calvo "Jose"
Reviews.Content: The price is great, the camera is also great100 % recommended

Reviews.Title: Brand is not all
Reviews.Author: R. Joseph "Trinihibiscus"
Reviews.Content: An OKish performing camera.  I bought it mainly because of the expectations associated with a Sony product.  The quality is not what I expected. Just to clarify, this camera does not seem to be designed for night photos.  I took it with me on a trip to Manhattan.  No matter what setting I used, the pictures had a red hue and were dark. You really can't appreciate the beauty of the Manhattan lights.  I had to do quite alot of touching!  Other than the night thing, the photos are a good quality.However I must mention that I bought an 8 mp Nikon for my Mum and the quality of the night photos are way better.

Reviews.Title: Waste of money..
Reviews.Author: K. Hegde "Hegde"
Reviews.Content: This camera sucks,no calrity,response time is too bad,odd kind of flash,No clarity in pics,it says 10MP but can not even cleary see my home furniture 1o feet away .Very cheap product,no more sony camera,Cannon/nikon rocks.

Reviews.Title: Sony Cybershot DSC-S950
Reviews.Author: M. Schultz
Reviews.Content: I think this is a great little camera. A friend of mine owns an older version and did some research for me and recommended this model. The feature she recommended was the rechargeable battery option so I'm glad I opted for this one. It takes great pictures and has tons of features. It's easy to work with and nice and compact. I take it where ever I go because it fits in my purse. I love that it's a subtle pink color and the whole camera has a jewel-like appearance. Very nice little machine.

Reviews.Title: high quality pictures
Reviews.Author: A. Rohe
Reviews.Content: Regarding to the price, this camera is obviously efficient and easy-useful.I should advise you to buy it if you are looking for a skillful good camera.The size and the weight are convenient too.

Reviews.Title: CAM
Reviews.Author: R. Gutierrez "RGG"
Reviews.Content: This product has some problems, when you zoom something, the cam freeze and you have to take out the battery ant turn it back in, and then it loose the malfunction, so i dont recommend it...

Reviews.Title: don't waste money
Reviews.Author: C. Huang
Reviews.Content: It is worst camera that I have ever seen.* slow respond* ISO mode is not working at all* can't zoom when video mode on.* Poor focus.* When playback, it takes a second for each and every pic to focus from initial graininess.First, I was replaced with new one because I though the ISO mode was defected.  But the new one was same issue.  I decided no bother it anymore.there are a lot of choice in the market.  don't waste your money on this model.

Reviews.Title: My daughter loves it
Reviews.Author: S. Book
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera for my daughters 12th birthday.  It is simple enough for her to handle and yet produces very nice pictures.  The picture stabalization feature is wonderful for her.

Reviews.Title: Good price, good brand
Reviews.Author: A. Mehta
Reviews.Content: i think my ratings says it allbut would add , i am really happy with the product.Specially the price of the product was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: BG
Reviews.Author: Belgica German "Belgica German"
Reviews.Content: Es una camara que posee buen mecanismo para la toma de fotos y grab. de videos.

Reviews.Title: Cybershot
Reviews.Author: C. McGrew "clm99"
Reviews.Content: I just received this product and have not had a lot of time to use it. So far it's great! The price was great!

Reviews.Title: Is a dscs980/b sony cyper shot a 12 mp or a 10 mp camera?
Reviews.Author: William Harple "Bill Harple"
Reviews.Content: Sony Cypershot dscs980/bIt is advertised by Amazon as a 12mp camera but when you put it in your cart it come out as a10mp. I can not really rate it as I will not  purchase this camera until I really know which it is, a 12mp or a 10mp.  I gave a 1 rating because they  required me to give a rating. Can anyone give me the answer?

Reviews.Title: BUENA....
Reviews.Author: Tiziana Ferrato
Reviews.Content: MUY BUENA PERO NO ES COMPATIBLE CON NADA!!! SOLO PUEDE USAR SU TARJETA DE MEMORIA, SU CABLE, SU BATERIA Y NO ES COMPATIBLE CON NINGUN OTRA MARCA....the camera is nice and good in general aspects, but it's memory card, connecting cable and battery are not compatible with any other brand.
